Uses of Class
com.aeonium.javafx.validation.exceptions.ValidationException

  • Packages that use ValidationException 
    Package Description
    com.aeonium.javafx.validation
    This package provides deklarative validation for JavaFX user interfaces with the following goals: A simple way of declaring validation constraints on a input field, an (at best) unobtrusive way of wiring submit controls to the validation.

    • Uses of ValidationException in com.aeonium.javafx.validation

      Methods in com.aeonium.javafx.validation that throw ValidationException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void FXAbstractValidator.validate()
      An overloaded version of validate(T control, A annotation) that uses the referenced control and annotation - use this as default method to trigger validation.
      void NotNullValidator.validate(javafx.scene.control.Control control, FXNotNull annotation) 
      static void ValidatorService.validate(java.lang.Object controller)
      Process all validators that belong to the given controller - this is failfast, the method quits validation on the first failure with an exception.
      abstract void FXAbstractValidator.validate(T control, A annotation)
      Validate the current data and/or state of control according to the validation constraints annotated at the field.
      void NumberValidator.validate(javafx.scene.control.TextInputControl control, FXNumber annotation)
      Check whether the text input could get parsed as a number - validation gets skipped if the control is either disabled or invisible.
      void RequiredValidator.validate(javafx.scene.control.TextInputControl control, FXRequired annotation)
      Validate a text input control - validation gets skipped if the control is either disabled or invisible.
      void StringValidator.validate(javafx.scene.control.TextInputControl control, FXString annotation)
